revised_title: Molecular Mechanisms of Cell Spreading and Locomotion
tldr: The article discusses the molecular biology of cell spreading and locomotion, focusing on the role of the cytoskeleton in controlling the distribution of pseudopodia. The author explains two types of stabilization mechanisms: microtubule-independent and microtubule-dependent processes. The article also highlights the importance of cytoskeletal elements in determining cell shape and directionality during spreading and locomotion.
